Major update: Gemini 3.0 integration & multi-file architecture

This major update introduces support for Google's newly released Gemini 3.0 models and completely refactors the application into a maintainable multi-file architecture.

üöÄ Gemini 3.0 integration

  • Hello, Gemini 3.0: Added Gemini 3.0 Pro and Gemini 3.0 Flash with improved reasoning, directness, and multimodal coherence compared to 2.5 versions.
  • Legacy model support: Gemini 2.5 Pro and Flash remain available but are now marked as legacy versions. Gemini 3.0 is recommended for new work.
  • Advanced prompting techniques: Added new "Gemini 3 Advanced" section to Best Practices covering structured prompting with XML tags, explicit planning, self-critique prompts, context anchoring, and multimodal synthesis.
  • Updated recommendations: All Gemini-related tool recommendations now include Gemini 3.0-specific prompting tips and best practices.

üèóÔ∏è Architecture overhaul

  • Multi-file structure: Refactored from single 713-line HTML file into organized multi-file architecture for easier maintenance and collaboration.
  • Separated concerns: Content data now lives in separate JSON files (decision-tree.json, case-studies.json, best-practices.json, model-info.json, tool-comparison.json, changelog.json), making updates simple for non-technical staff.
  • Modular JavaScript: All application logic consolidated into a single app.js file that dynamically loads data, enabling easier feature additions and debugging.
  • Clean HTML/CSS: Separated styles into styles.css and streamlined index.html for better readability and maintainability.
  • FTP-ready: Optimized file structure for straightforward deployment to centerforcooperativemedia.org/tools/llmadvisor.
  • Vibe coding guide: Added footer link to supplementary vibe coding guide for journalists learning to work with LLMs.

Content update: New case study

A new case study has been added, demonstrating how AI can generate alt text for infographics to improve accessibility.

  • Added: "Improving infographic accessibility with AI alt text" from Generative AI in the Newsroom.

  • Added: "Administrative boon, editorial question: Generative AI‚Äôs role in small newsrooms" from Generative AI in the Newsroom (GAIN).

  • Added: "How CT Mirror uses custom AI to cover 169 towns" from Poynter.

Major update: GPT-5 & Nano Banana integration

This update fully integrates OpenAI's new flagship model, GPT-5, and Google's new image generation model, Nano Banana. The tool's recommendations and best practices have been overhauled to align with the next generation of prompting techniques.

‚ú® Model and recommendation updates

  • Hello, GPT-5: OpenAI's GPT-5 has been added and now replaces ChatGPT o3 as the top-tier "Work" model for complex reasoning and agentic tasks. Check out the official GPT-5 Prompting Guide from OpenAI Cookbook here.
  • Smarter coding advice: GPT-5 is now included as a leading recommendation for coding tasks, with updated tips on when to use it versus other models like Claude 4 Opus.
  • Next-gen prompts: All sample prompts and tips have been revised to incorporate GPT-5 best practices, including techniques for asking the AI to self-correct, writing clearer instructions, and getting more proactive responses.
  • Meet Nano Banana üçå: Google's new image generation model, Gemini (Nano Banana üçå), has been added with new recommendations for text-to-image, conversational editing, and more. Read the full image prompting guide from Google here.

üß† Best practices 2.0

The "Best Practices" guide has been completely rewritten to include cutting-edge, practical techniques for getting the most out of modern LLMs, including a new section on prompting for images and a template for maintaining a project changelog.

Content update: New case study

A new case study has been added to the "Case Studies" modal, focusing on prompt engineering for newsletters.

  • Added: "Personalizing newsletters: Iterative prompt evaluation and improvement" from Ashlyn Wang at Generative AI in the Newsroom.

Model tiers & system-focused updates

As noted by Ethan Mollick, the landscape is shifting from finding the single "best model" to choosing the "best system" and, most importantly, the right tier of model for your specific task.

  • Introducing model tiers: The advisor's core recommendation engine now helps you choose between fast 'Chat' models (for brainstorming) and powerful 'Work' models (for high-stakes tasks).
  • Updated tool information: All tool recommendations, descriptions, and comparisons have been updated to reflect the latest model names and capabilities from Anthropic, Google, and OpenAI.
  • Smarter recommendations: The decision tree is now more nuanced, guiding you to select the appropriate model tier based on the complexity and importance of your task.
  • Revised "Best Practices" guide: The guide has been significantly overhauled to include modern, practical advice on choosing a system, using 'Deep Research' modes, and managing privacy.

Functional and mobile view improvements

This update introduces functional improvements, user interface enhancements, and a fully optimized mobile version of the tool.

‚ú® Functional improvements

  • Progress bar activated: The progress bar now tracks your path through the decision tree, providing a visual indicator of your progress toward a recommendation.
  • Breadcrumb navigation enabled: A breadcrumb trail is now displayed below the progress bar, showing your current selection path for easier navigation.
  • Workflow dropdown fixed: An issue was resolved where some selections in the "Jump to a workflow" dropdown were not working. All options now correctly navigate to the corresponding recommendation page.

üì± Mobile view optimizations

A lighter version of the application now loads on mobile browsers to improve performance and usability on smaller screens.

  • Compact layout: Padding and margins have been reduced for a more efficient use of space.
  • Improved readability: Typography has been adjusted for better legibility on mobile devices.
  • Enhanced touch controls: Interactive elements are now better optimized for touch input.

Major stability and UI/UX overhaul

This major update brings a completely refreshed and stabilized LLM Tool Advisor experience.

‚ú® Functional improvements

  • Core system overhaul: Addressed foundational issues to ensure the app builds, deploys, and runs reliably.
  • Dark mode persistence: Your dark/light mode preference is now saved and will persist across sessions.
  • Enhanced error handling: Implemented a new Error Boundary to gracefully catch and display issues.

üé® UI/UX enhancements

  • Dynamic animated background: Introducing a vibrant, animated gradient background.
  • Smooth animations & transitions: Integrated fluid animations for page transitions, button interactions, and modal pop-ups.
  • Upgraded iconography: Replaced and added icons for a cleaner and more consistent visual language.
  • Interactive modals: Tool Comparison, Case Studies, and Best Practices modals are now fully interactive.
